oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1960-09-17 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from September 17, 1960. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Hank Snow (host/performer), guest performer Hank Locklin, and regular performers the Jordanaires, Tommy Jackson, Jimmie Selph, Chet Atkins, Archie Campbell, and Stringbean. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 1093rd broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hank Snow; Jordanaires; Hank Locklin; Tommy Jackson; Jimmie Selph; Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Hank Snow -- I'm Movin' On (Hank Snow) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner) -- Hank Snow introduces the Jordanaires -- Ain't Gonna Study War No More (Jordanaires) -- Hank Snow introduces Hank Locklin -- Please Help Me, I'm Falling (Hank Locklin, Jordanaires) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Hank Snow) -- Hank Snow introduces Tommy Jackson and Jimmie Selph -- Old Joe Clark (Tommy Jackson fiddle, Jimmie Selph calls) -- Grant Turner and Hank Snow talk -- Farther Along (Hank Snow, Jordanaires) -- Hank Snow introduces Chet Atkins -- The Third Man Theme (Chet Atkins)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Smathers, Ben, -1990; Stoney Mountain Cloggers; Jackson, Tommy; Campbell, Archie; Atkins, Chet; Stringbean, 1915-1973; Jordanaires (Musical group); Snow, Hank; Wise, Chubby; Locklin, Hank
